text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

My life's purpose is to leave
this world a better place
than I came into it.

Growing up a child of
Western African immigrants,

the values of
community and education

were paramount to our
core of who we are.

These resulted in me
gaining certain skill sets

and opportunities I really
could have only dreamed of.

That alongside a determined
will to help others succeed.

For my family, that means
to instill these same values

in my children, and to continue
to be a loving husband and son.

For my community, it
means to make sure

that I pay these same
opportunities forward,

because ultimately, I know I
did not achieve this on my own.

And lastly, for my profession,
it means to embark in a place

where I can help
to pull others up

while also working to
direct the flow of capital

to businesses and communities
that may be underserved

or that simply help to make
our world more efficient.

That, to me, is
my life's purpose,

to ultimately have an impact and
leave this world a better place
than I came into it.
